title: Friends of the Israel Defense Forces Casino Night Sponsored by The Cooper Idea Foundation and World Patent Marketing Miami
text:
The Cooper Idea Foundation Honors World Patent Marketing Advisory Board Member, Brigadier General (Res.) Nitzan Nuriel, with Donation to the Friends of the Israel Defense Forces
Miami, Florida (PRWEB) October 21, 2015
The Cooper Idea Foundation and World Patent Marketing have once again shown its commitment to supporting the State of Israel and the Israel Defense Forces. Scott J. Cooper, CEO and Creative Director of World Patent Marketing , made the donation in honor of his close friend and confidante, Brig. General (Res.) Nitzan Nuriel of the IDF.
General Nuriel was honored by the Congress of the United States last month during the week of September 11 for his commitment to world security and the fight against terrorism. General Nuriel was Military Attache to the Israeli Embassy in Washington DC, where he served as the official liaison between the US Army, Marine Corps, Special Operations Command, FEMA and Homeland Security. He received the Legion of Merit from the President of the United States for his exceptional accomplishments.
"The Cooper Idea Foundation and my friend Scott Cooper are great supporters of the State of Israel." said General Nuriel, "As a soldier and General in the IDF, I can tell you that events like this make a difference in the lives of our soldiers on the front lines. Now more then ever, your contributions matter."
"We are proud to be able support the Friends of the IDF Young Leadership Program," said Scott J. Cooper, CEO and Creative Director of World Patent Marketing , "I spent a lot of time with General Nuriel this summer in Israel. He has devoted his career to protecting the State of Israel and fighting the global war on terror. We are proud to make this contribution in his honor."
"It is always important for the South Florida community to come out and show their support for Israel and her soldiers, but it is especially imperative now during this particularly challenging time period in Israel, as Israelis are experiencing a rising tide of terror attacks, and it is the brave IDF soldiers whose lives are on the line each and every day protecting our only Jewish state." said Co-President Jaime Mittleman. "Right now, as Israelis are experiencing a rising tide of terror attacks, it is even more important then ever for our community to come out and show their support for Israel and the brave IDF soldiers, whose lives are on the line each and every day, protecting our only Jewish state."
About Friends of the IDF
Friends of the Israel Defense Forces (FIDF) was established in 1981 by a group of Holocaust survivors, under the leadership of John Klein z'l, to provide for education and well being of the men and women who serve in the Israel Defense Forces (IDF) as well as the families of fallen soldiers. Headquartered in New York City, FIDF is a 501c3 not-for-profit corporation that operates 15 regional offices in the United States and Panama.
The strength of the IDF, which has been guarding the State of Israel since it declared independence in 1948, derives from the selfless determination and great capabilities of the young men and women who form it. At the tender age of 18, all Israelis are drafted into the IDF. Those who serve commit to uphold the difficult tasks of defending Israel’s borders and guaranteeing the safety of its people.
The Israeli government is responsible for training IDF soldiers and providing them with the necessary tools for their service. FIDF is committed to providing these soldiers with love, support, and care in an effort to ease the burden they carry on behalf of the Jewish community worldwide.
Their job is to look after Israel. Ours is to look after them.
About The Cooper Idea Foundation
The Cooper Idea Foundation is dedicated to providing funding for special causes around the world. Established by the Cooper Family, the Foundation believes that innovation is vital to the state of the world’s children. Led by Scott Cooper, CEO and Creative Director of World Patent Marketing, the Foundation’s goal is to help young people push the boundaries of what’s possible and create a future they want. Our goal is to raise expectations and the hopes and dreams of every child on Earth. Recently, The Cooper Idea Foundation dedicated the Cooper Kindergarten and the Cooper Computer Center in Israel.
The Cooper Idea Foundation (Cooper) uses the power of invention to improve lives, by inspiring and enabling the next generation of inventors and invention-based enterprises to promote economic growth in the US, and social and economic progress for the poor in developing countries. The Cooper Idea Foundation employs a group of dedicated intellectual property specialists dedicated to the development and administration of licensing programs on behalf of third party companies and organizations.
Our expertise extends to intellectual property law, technology standardization, strategic business development, and program administration. Affiliated specialists in the fields of finance, antitrust law, and patent analysis complete the set of capabilities that make Cooper a premier service provider to companies and organizations seeking patent licensing administration services.
Our patent portfolio spans more than 50 technology areas from agriculture to software. Our patents come from individual inventors, start-ups, large corporations and research institutions.
Learn more about The Cooper Idea Foundation by visiting our web site at https://cooperideas.org
